data.name: Keto Diet
data.details: The Keto Diet focuses on reducing carbohydrate intake and increasing fats to promote ketosis, a metabolic state where the body burns fat for energy.
objectives: Maintain ketosis
Limit carb intake to 20-50 grams per day
Increase healthy fat consumption
data.guideline: Ensure you monitor your macronutrient intake closely and stay hydrated. Consult a healthcare provider before starting the Keto Diet.

data.name: Low Calorie
data.details: A Low Calorie diet involves consuming fewer calories than your body needs to promote weight loss.
objectives: Consume 1200-1500 calories per day
Include nutrient-dense foods
Avoid high-calorie snacks
data.guideline: Track your caloric intake using a food diary or app. Ensure you're meeting your nutritional needs despite the calorie reduction.

data.name: Intermittent Fasting
data.details: Intermittent Fasting involves cycling between periods of eating and fasting to help manage weight and improve metabolic health.
objectives: Fast for 16 hours, eat within an 8-hour window
Consume balanced meals during eating periods
Stay hydrated during fasting
data.guideline: Start with shorter fasting periods and gradually increase. Listen to your body and avoid over-eating during eating periods.

data.name: High Protein
data.details: A High Protein diet helps to support muscle growth and repair by providing essential amino acids.
objectives: Consume 1.5-2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight
Include protein in every meal
Focus on lean protein sources
data.guideline: Spread protein intake throughout the day. Combine with strength training exercises for optimal results.

data.name: Bodybuilding
data.details: The Bodybuilding plan involves a combination of high protein intake and structured resistance training to maximize muscle growth.
objectives: Follow a structured workout plan
Consume a calorie surplus with high protein intake
Rest and recover adequately
data.guideline: Ensure you follow a balanced diet with enough calories to support muscle growth. Include rest days to allow muscles to recover.

data.name: Paleo
data.details: The Paleo diet emphasizes whole foods and lean proteins, mimicking the diet of our hunter-gatherer ancestors.
objectives: Avoid processed foods
Include lean meats, fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds
Stay hydrated
data.guideline: Focus on whole, unprocessed foods. Avoid dairy, grains, and processed sugar.

data.name: Balanced Diet
data.details: A Balanced Diet provides all essential nutrients in the right proportions to maintain health and energy levels.
objectives: Eat a variety of foods from all food groups
Include fruits, vegetables, grains, proteins, and dairy
Stay within your daily calorie needs
data.guideline: Follow the dietary guidelines for balanced meals. Ensure you have a mix of macronutrients in each meal.

data.name: Mediterranean
data.details: The Mediterranean diet emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and healthy fats, known for its heart health benefits.
objectives: Include olive oil as a primary fat source
Eat plenty of fruits and vegetables
Include fish and poultry
data.guideline: Adopt Mediterranean eating patterns, focusing on fresh, whole foods and reducing red meat and processed foods.

data.name: Whole30
data.details: The Whole30 program focuses on eating whole, unprocessed foods and eliminating sugar, alcohol, grains, legumes, and dairy.
objectives: Eliminate processed foods
Focus on whole foods like vegetables, fruits, and lean proteins
Avoid added sugars and artificial ingredients
data.guideline: Strictly follow the elimination guidelines for 30 days. Reintroduce foods gradually to identify any adverse reactions.

data.name: Vegan Balanced
data.details: A Vegan Balanced diet ensures you get all necessary nutrients while following a plant-based eating pattern.
objectives: Include a variety of fruits, vegetables, grains, and legumes
Ensure adequate protein intake from plant sources
Monitor B12 and iron levels
data.guideline: Ensure a diverse diet to cover all nutritional bases. Consider supplements for nutrients like B12.

data.name: Raw Vegan
data.details: A Raw Vegan diet consists of unprocessed, raw plant foods that have not been heated above 118°F (48°C).
objectives: Consume fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, and sprouted grains
Avoid all processed and cooked foods
Stay hydrated
data.guideline: Focus on fresh, raw ingredients. Ensure you're meeting your nutritional needs, especially for protein and fat.

data.name: High Protein Vegan
data.details: The High Protein Vegan diet ensures sufficient protein intake through plant-based sources to support muscle maintenance and growth.
objectives: Include beans, lentils, tofu, tempeh, and seitan
Incorporate nuts and seeds
Monitor protein intake to meet daily requirements
data.guideline: Balance your diet with a variety of high-protein plant foods. Consider protein supplements if needed.

data.name: Gluten-Free Balanced
data.details: A Gluten-Free Balanced diet provides all necessary nutrients while eliminating gluten-containing foods.
aims: Manage celiac disease or gluten sensitivity
objectives: Avoid wheat, barley, rye, and other gluten-containing grains
Include gluten-free grains like rice, quinoa, and millet
Ensure adequate fiber intake
data.guideline: Read labels carefully to avoid gluten. Focus on naturally gluten-free foods and a balanced diet.

data.name: Paleo Gluten-Free
data.details: The Paleo Gluten-Free diet combines the principles of the Paleo diet with the elimination of gluten-containing foods.
objectives: Avoid processed foods and grains
Focus on lean meats, fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds
Avoid dairy and gluten
data.guideline: Ensure a diverse intake of whole foods. Avoid any processed or packaged foods that may contain gluten.

data.name: Low FODMAP
data.description: Low FODMAP foods to reduce digestive distress
data.details: The Low FODMAP diet helps reduce digestive distress by eliminating foods that are high in fermentable oligosaccharides, disaccharides, monosaccharides, and polyols.
objectives: Eliminate high FODMAP foods
Gradually reintroduce foods to identify triggers
Maintain balanced nutrition despite restrictions
data.guideline: Follow the elimination phase strictly. Reintroduce foods one at a time to identify any intolerances.

data.name: Low Glycemic Index
data.description: Foods with a low glycemic index
data.details: The Low Glycemic Index diet includes foods that have a minimal impact on blood sugar levels.
objectives: Include whole grains, legumes, and non-starchy vegetables
Avoid high glycemic index foods
Monitor blood sugar levels regularly
data.guideline: Choose foods with a low glycemic index. Combine carbohydrates with proteins and fats to slow digestion.

data.name: Mediterranean Diabetic
data.details: The Mediterranean Diabetic diet combines the heart-healthy principles of the Mediterranean diet with a focus on managing blood sugar levels.
objectives: Focus on whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and healthy fats
Include lean proteins and fish
Limit added sugars and refined carbs
data.guideline: Adopt a Mediterranean eating pattern while focusing on blood sugar management. Avoid processed foods.

data.name: Carb Counting
data.description: Manage carbohydrate intake for better blood sugar control
data.details: The Carb Counting diet involves tracking carbohydrate intake to better manage blood sugar levels.
objectives: Count carbohydrates at each meal and snack
Distribute carbohydrate intake evenly throughout the day
Monitor blood sugar levels
data.guideline: Work with a dietitian to determine your carbohydrate needs. Use carb counting tools and apps for accurate tracking.

data.name: DASH Diet
data.description: Reduce sodium and increase nutrient-rich foods
data.details: The DASH (Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension) diet focuses on reducing sodium intake and eating a variety of nutrient-rich foods to lower blood pressure.
objectives: Reduce sodium intake to less than 2300 mg per day
Include fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins
Avoid processed and high-sodium foods
data.guideline: Follow the DASH diet principles. Monitor your sodium intake and choose fresh, whole foods.

data.name: Ornish Diet
data.description: Low-fat, vegetarian diet for cardiovascular health
data.details: The Ornish Diet is a low-fat, vegetarian diet designed to improve cardiovascular health and reverse heart disease.
objectives: Adopt a plant-based diet with minimal animal products
Reduce fat intake to 10% of total calories
Include whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and legumes
data.guideline: Follow a strict low-fat, vegetarian diet. Avoid added oils and high-fat foods.

data.name: TLC Diet
data.description: Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes to reduce cholesterol
data.details: The TLC (Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes) diet is designed to reduce cholesterol levels and promote heart health.
objectives: Limit saturated fat to less than 7% of total calories
Include soluble fiber-rich foods
Avoid trans fats
data.guideline: Adopt a diet low in saturated fat and cholesterol. Increase intake of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.

data.name: Prenatal Nutrition
data.details: Prenatal Nutrition focuses on meeting the increased nutritional needs of pregnancy to support the health of both mother and baby.
objectives: Include a variety of nutrient-dense foods
Ensure adequate intake of folic acid, iron, and calcium
Stay hydrated
data.guideline: Follow dietary guidelines for pregnancy. Consult with a healthcare provider to ensure nutritional needs are met.

data.name: Postpartum Recovery
data.details: The Postpartum Recovery diet focuses on nutrient-dense foods to support healing and recovery after childbirth.
objectives: Include protein-rich foods for tissue repair
Ensure adequate hydration
Include iron-rich foods to replenish stores
data.guideline: Focus on nutrient-dense, healing foods. Rest and gradually return to normal activities as energy levels allow.

data.name: Breastfeeding Diet
data.details: The Breastfeeding Diet provides essential nutrients to support lactation and the health of both mother and baby.
objectives: Include a variety of nutrient-dense foods
Ensure adequate calorie and fluid intake
Avoid alcohol and limit caffeine
data.guideline: Focus on a balanced diet with sufficient calories and nutrients. Stay hydrated and avoid substances that can affect milk supply.
